result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore J Engelke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Theodore J Engelke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Theodore J Engelke was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore J Engelke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:38 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Thomas Chalchoff.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Chalchoff - will be a plea & sentencing and files the stip with the court.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to No Contest  to count 1 on 2016CM41 and will plea No Contest to 2015TR1572.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Chalchoff.  No statement by the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to 2015TR1572.  Court finds the defendant Guilty.

Court sentences the defendant to:

15TR1572

-$150 forfeiture plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 6 months
-IID - 12 months
-AODA (winnebago)

COUNT 1

-$100 Fine and costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Statement by Atty Chalchoff in regards to the Ignition Interlock Device.  Statement by the Court - requests something submitted in writing to the court and the court will review.

Court adjourned at 8:50 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

10:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Thomas Chalchoff.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over conversation held prior to court.  Court ses for Plea & sentencing on June 6, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:12 a.m.
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with AttyChalchoff.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Chalchoff confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Chalchoff enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and   Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Heairng on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 8:35 a.m.

Atty Thomas Chalchoff called, has been retained to represent the defendant and requests an adjournment as he will be out of State.  Adjourned to March 15, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.  Notice of Retainer to be filed.
43
